item.title: GOP Senate Bill Would Cut Health Care Coverage By 22 Million
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Congressional forecasters say a Senate Republican bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act would leave 22 million more people uninsured in the next decade.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Congressional forecasters say a Senate Republican bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act would leave 22 million more people uninsured in the next decade. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534432433/gop-senate-bill-would-cut-health-care-coverage-by-22-million

item.title: In Texas, Opponents Rally Against Senate Republican Health Care Bill
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Despite its politicians' positions, many people who live in Texas' rural hill country came out this weekend in support of the existing health care law. But some near the gathering support Obamacare repeal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Despite its politicians' positions, many people who live in Texas' rural hill country came out this weekend in support of the existing health care law. But some near the gathering support Obamacare repeal. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534448022/in-texas-opponents-rally-against-senate-republican-health-care-bill

item.title: Congressional Budget Office To Announce Score Of GOP Health Care Bill
item.description:
June 26, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office plans to announce its score of the Senate Republican health care bill.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534447897/congressional-budget-office-to-announce-score-of-gop-health-care-bill
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - The Congressional Budget Office plans to announce its score of the Senate Republican health care bill. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534447897/congressional-budget-office-to-announce-score-of-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: 'Pharma Bro' Martin Shkreli Goes On Trial On Securities Fraud Charges
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Shkreli is charged with committing a series of frauds well before he became "the most hated man in America." He's been livestreaming and spending lavishly, though according to his lawyer, he's broke.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Shkreli is charged with committing a series of frauds well before he became "the most hated man in America." He's been livestreaming and spending lavishly, though according to his lawyer, he's broke. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/06/26/534411641/pharma-bro-martin-shkreli-goes-on-trial-on-securities-fraud-charges

item.title: After Decline Of Steel And Coal, Ohio Fears Health Care Jobs Are Next
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Health care jobs now outnumber manufacturing jobs in Jefferson County, Ohio. Hospital administrators worry that Republican plans to cut Medicaid will lead to layoffs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Health care jobs now outnumber manufacturing jobs in Jefferson County, Ohio. Hospital administrators worry that Republican plans to cut Medicaid will lead to layoffs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/26/533973916/after-decline-of-steel-and-coal-ohio-fears-health-care-jobs-are-next

item.title: Senate Republicans Alter Health Care Bill To Avoid 'Death Spiral'
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Senate Republicans have tweaked their bill in hopes of keeping more healthy customers in the insurance market. Customers who fail to maintain coverage could be temporarily locked out.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Senate Republicans have tweaked their bill in hopes of keeping more healthy customers in the insurance market. Customers who fail to maintain coverage could be temporarily locked out. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534428929/senate-republicans-alter-health-care-bill-to-avoid-so-called-death-spiral

item.title: More Health Problems Reported With Hair And Skin Care Products
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Manufacturers are not required to tell the Food and Drug Administration about safety issues with cosmetics or hair and skin care products. That can leave people in the dark about health risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Manufacturers are not required to tell the Food and Drug Administration about safety issues with cosmetics or hair and skin care products. That can leave people in the dark about health risks. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/26/534411597/more-health-problems-reported-with-hair-and-skin-care-products

item.title: Cholera Hitches A Ride On The Backs Of Soft-Shell Turtles
item.description:
June 26, 2017 - A new study finds that turtles are really good at carrying the bacteria that cause the potentially fatal disease.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/533639747/cholera-hitches-a-ride-on-the-backs-of-soft-shell-turtles
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - A new study finds that turtles are really good at carrying the bacteria that cause the potentially fatal disease. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/533639747/cholera-hitches-a-ride-on-the-backs-of-soft-shell-turtles

item.title: Secrets Of Breast-Feeding From Global Moms In The Know
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Many American women want to breast-feed — and try to. Only about half keep it up. It's like they've lost the instinct. One researcher thinks she's figured out why and how to get the instinct back.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Many American women want to breast-feed — and try to. Only about half keep it up. It's like they've lost the instinct. One researcher thinks she's figured out why and how to get the instinct back. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/06/26/534021439/secrets-of-breast-feeding-from-global-moms-in-the-know

item.title: Senate Republicans Have Their Work Cut Out For Them With Health Bill
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Senators could have another bit of information on Monday to help their decision-making. The Congressional Budget Office is expected to give its assessment of the bill's impact.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Senators could have another bit of information on Monday to help their decision-making. The Congressional Budget Office is expected to give its assessment of the bill's impact. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534377334/senate-republicans-have-their-work-cut-out-for-them-with-health-bill

item.title: What Women Should Keep In Mind When They're Thinking Of Breast-Feeding
item.description: June 26, 2017 - A majority of women say they want to breast-feed their babies. But only a small fraction reach that goal. Why is it so hard? Maybe the secrets of breast-feeding are in the past.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - A majority of women say they want to breast-feed their babies. But only a small fraction reach that goal. Why is it so hard? Maybe the secrets of breast-feeding are in the past. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534368758/what-women-should-keep-in-mind-when-theyre-thinking-of-breastfeeding

item.title: Can Republicans In The Senate Get Their Health Bill Passed?
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Republicans and Democrats have different priorities for what the health care bill should do. Some Republicans have already come out against the bill and have said they won't vote for the measure.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Republicans and Democrats have different priorities for what the health care bill should do. Some Republicans have already come out against the bill and have said they won't vote for the measure. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534365607/can-republicans-in-the-senate-get-their-health-bill-passed

item.title: Avalere Health's President Is Concerned About Health Care Bill's Effects
item.description: June 26, 2017 - For reaction to the Senate Republican health care bill that was made public last week, Rachel Martin talks to Dan Mendelson, president of Avalere Health, a consulting firm.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - For reaction to the Senate Republican health care bill that was made public last week, Rachel Martin talks to Dan Mendelson, president of Avalere Health, a consulting firm. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534365600/avalere-healths-president-is-concerned-about-health-care-bills-effects

item.title: Morning News Brief: GOP Health Care Bill, Modi To Visit White House
item.description: June 26, 2017 - Two GOP factions say they won't back the bill, and the Congressional Budget office soon offers an assessment of the bill's impact. And, President Trump holds meetings with India's Prime Minister Modi.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 26, 2017 - Two GOP factions say they won't back the bill, and the Congressional Budget office soon offers an assessment of the bill's impact. And, President Trump holds meetings with India's Prime Minister Modi. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/26/534365544/morning-news-brief-gop-health-care-bill-modi-to-visit-white-house

item.title: Where Does The Federal Budget Deficit Fit Into The Health Care Equation?
item.description: June 25, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget President Maya MacGuineas about how to balance the need for health care with the need to reduce the federal budget deficit.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 25, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget President Maya MacGuineas about how to balance the need for health care with the need to reduce the federal budget deficit. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/25/534332888/where-does-the-federal-budget-deficit-fit-into-the-health-care-equation
